Posts.Content: Anita1969 wrote: Hi you guys, I know I can always count on you for some sage advice, a cyber-tissue and HOPE. I have lately been on Gemzar and Herceptin. Herceptin for a while. My new ONC did not feel my dose of Gemzar was enough. I had a scan last week. Well, the results are in and she was right. Everything is a little bigger. (Liver mets) So much so that we decided to bale on Gemzar and stop Herceptin in favor of Xeloda and Tykerb. There is some question about bone mets. I was originally dx 7/06 - Stage IV, Her2+, liver mets and possible bone mets. Bone scan came back clean, CT scan shows bone concerns. In May, I had another bone scan and it too came back clean. Liver biopsy another story. I had a CT on 8/8/07. That is when everything was bigger and the CT continues to show bone mets(?). So ONC ordered another bone scan for next week to get a baseline for these new drugs (and possibly start me on Zometa). Ladies, I need some positive energy and prayers. I have a little boy, 4 1/2. This diagnosis still (a year later) seems like some outrageously insane awful nightmare. Any helpful hints or things I should be on the look out for with these meds? Tykerb once a day 21 days, 1250 mg; Xeloda 2000 mg twice a day 14 days on, 7 days off. I am just really frustrated and sad and scared right now. Anita Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Lousy Scan Results & Change to Xeloda /Tykerb Anita1969 EstherCA

Posts.Content: Aug 13, 2007 07:52AM Anita1969 wrote: Thanks Debbie! I know the odds are not in our favor, but we can't allow ourselves to be counted in the statistics!
Posts.Title: Lousy Scan Results & Change to Xeloda /Tykerb Anita1969 EstherCA

Posts.Content: Anita1969 wrote: Hi Everyone,  Been a while since I posted and I need to ask for your prayers.  In early February, my husband and I went down to FL to take my son, 5, to Disney and while we were down there, I had sever head pressure, was admitted to the hospital and diagnosed with Brain Mets.  3 weeks of WBR, Steriotactic Radio Surgery down there and now I am finally home and exhausted.  Trying to get back to "normal".  CT scan tomorrow to check guts.  MRI beginning of Apri to check head.  Oh, you guys!  We need more miracles on this earth.  No one deserves this!!!  At the ripe old age of 38 with a 5 year old, I should be worried about broken crayons and the dog peeing on the carpet, how I can help others and other more positive things....   Anita  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: And the hits just keep on coming... Anita1969 MissShapen

Posts.Content: Dec 10, 2007 09:29PM Anita1969 wrote: Yes!  We all have those moments.  Mine came IN church this spring at Easter service.  A lady who also attends regularly leaned over to us and told my 4 year old son how handsome he looked in his new suit.  I was sporting a new short wig for spring and she commented that she liked my new hairdo.  My son promptly returned with, "It's a wig!"  I just held my head high and said, "Thank you, Thomas.  Now let's sit down." Now, it is definitely a moment to laugh about.  As is the time he blew of my wig at the science museum.  I was VERY thankful that time that there was no one else on the floor! Anita

Posts.Content: Aug 2, 2007 01:39PM Anita1969 wrote: Oh Joanne! How sad!! I am stage IV as well. The only thing I can think of that would be worse would be if my son who is 4 1/2 would have it. He is my strength to get me through this. You're right, maybe there was a good reason, but I don't think I could leave my kid's side! Prayers for all of us. Anita

Posts.Content: Jan 18, 2007 01:53AM Anita1969 wrote: Hi Guys, Anita here. I was at the onc's on Monday to resume herceptin. I had surgery on 1/10. Bilat Mast. He's recommended 4-6 months of more chemo. Abraxane. I tolerate it reasonably well. My fingerbeds get sore and 5 are lifting, but that is all really. I am depressed about it though. I knew more chemo was a very likely after surgery, but that came as a blow. Anyone have any encouragement to share?
